errorCode.name: FAILED_GET_INIT_STATUS

errorCode.name: FAILED_WAITING_DB_INIT
errorCode.message: Failed waiting for the database to initialize.
errorCode.possibleCause: This exception is thrown when a connection times out waiting for the database to enter the intialized state. This can occur if there is a fatal error during the intialization process, which leaves the database in a partially configured state.
errorCode.suggestedFix:
If this is a new database, and it has failed to initialize, there easiest way to clear the problem is to drop the database and start over with a fresh database. You can also try to do this by setting the org.openanzo.repository.database.clearOnLoad property to true.
If this is an existing database, that is already populated with data, there is a more serious problem.

errorCode.name: MALFORMED_LITERAL
errorCode.description: Indicates that a literal has an invalid lexical value. For example: "verdad"^^xsd:boolean is a malformed literal because the lexical form of xsd:boolean only allows: "true", "false", "0", or "1".
errorCode.message: Malformed literal: {0} is not a valid lexical value for type: {1}
errorCode.possibleCause: Invalid data in the repository. Not all typed literals are checked for conformance to their prescribed lexical form. The check only happens when it is necessary as part of evaluating the SPARQL query. As such, this exception is most often triggered when a literal must be interpreted for use in comparison operations and type conversions.
errorCode.suggestedFix: Correct the invalid literal value or use a query that does not involve computations or comparisons of that literal.

errorCode.name: NO_DATASET_IN_SUBQUERY
errorCode.message: SPARQL subqueries may not contain a FROM, FROM NAMED, or FROM DATASET clause.
errorCode.suggestedFix: Remove the FROM, FROM NAMED, or FROM DATASET clause from all subqueries.

errorCode.name: TOO_MANY_SOLUTIONS
errorCode.message: Too many solutions in solution set: {0}.
errorCode.suggestedFix: Use a more constrained query, or query against a smaller dataset.

errorCode.name: PREDICATE_TYPE_ERROR
errorCode.message: Triple pattern predicate must be one of: variable, IRI [{0}]

errorCode.name: BINARYSTORE_FILE_REVISION_DOES_NOT_EXIST
errorCode.message: The revision {0} does not exist for binary store file: {1}
errorCode.possibleCause: The requested revision number is either too large, or the revision applies to a graph edit rather than a file update, or the revision is an old revision of a non-revisioned file.
errorCode.suggestedFix: Request a different revision or omit the revision argument to obtain the latest revision.
